alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 28 at 6:55PM PST until January 01 at 2:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PST MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 6 to 12 feet with local sets to 15 feet in northern Orange County. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding is expected. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...Until 2 AM PST Monday. Highest surf will be Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Locations most susceptible to flooding include Seal Beach, Sunset Beach, and Newport Beach. Here are the projected highest tides of each day for Newport Beach: Friday, December 29: 5.8 feet at 944 AM. Saturday, December 30: 5.4 feet at 1020 AM. Sunday, December 31: 4.9 feet at 1058 AM.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
